GeneralInformation.School Vision: Every Qihuaian a learner, a leader and a champion.
GeneralInformation.School Mission: Nurturing future-ready leaders committed to giving their best to family, community and Singapore.
GeneralInformation.School Philosophy, Culture and Ethos: Qihua Primary School strives to provide an all-round education to its pupils, guided by its values and providing opportunities for every child to excel in his or her pursuits. To actualise its vision, it seeks to build a learning community that actively engages in experimenting creative pedagogies to help its pupils be the best that they can be.  School Philosophy: Every child is valued; his/ her uniqueness nurtured.  School Ethos: To Teach with Passion; To Lead with Benevolence  School Motto: Persevere to Succeed  School Values: Care, Integrity, Respect, Responsibility, Resilience, Teamwork  School History:  Qihua Primary School is the Hanyu Pinyin name of Kay Wah School. It was founded in 1938 by a group of forward-looking pioneers led by Mr Neo Tiew, a philanthropist and village head of Ama Keng. In Chinese, Qihua means 'rousing the learning spirit'  . The school then expanded from the Main school to Branch I and II, to accommodate the quest for learning of the residents' children in that area. The school adopted English as its medium of instruction and shifted to Woodlands in 1980, continuing its journey in serving the community.
GeneralInformation.Type of School: GOVERNMENT SCHOOL / CO-ED SCHOOL / SINGLE SESSION

School Distinctive Programmes.Innovation & Enterprise: Inventive and Critical Thinking Skills through Innovation and Entrepreneurship Excellence Programme
School Distinctive Programmes.Sports & Outdoor Education: Promotion of School Values through Sports Development Programme (SDP)

SpecialProgrammes.Special Student Development Programmes O: The school actualises its vision through holistic development of students, leveraging on pupil-centric approaches and curriculum innovations amidst a values-based digital environment to enable every child's uniqueness to be nurtured.  1. Applied Learning Programme (ALP) - Innovation and Entrepreneurship (I&E) Programme Our ALP develops pupils to be confident communicators equipped with inventive thinking skills. Pupils are able create content, internalise school values and learn the principles of I&E. Pupils showcase their innovations during the annual 'InnoJoy Fest'. 2. Learning for Life Programme (LLP) - Sports Development Programme (SDP) Our LLP is anchored on school values and brings about increased sports participation, sustained sports achievement, improved physical fitness and encourages pupils to internalise school values. 3. Inter-disciplinary Project Work (IPW) IPW encourages pupils to be self-directed and effective collaborative learners.  Pupils are taught explicitly inquiry-based skills, science process skills and ICT skills. 4. Pupil-led Conferencing To build confident and self-directed learners, all pupils are involved in the parent-pupil conferencing with the form teachers as the facilitators during the session. 5. Improving Computer Literacy among Pupils Programme (ICLAP) The ICLAP focuses on teaching pupils the different ICT skills and good Cyberwellness practices. 6. Modular Art & Music Programme The Modular Art and Music programmes like pottery, batik painting, printmaking, P2 Dance, ukulele and keyboard programme certainly help to enhance pupils' aesthetics experience. 7. S.Q.U.A.T. Programme S.Q.U.AT. which stands for Smile, Question, Understand, Alert & Tune-in is intended to enable teachers to know their pupils on a deeper level and to help pupils find joy in school. This initiative comprises programmes like Start It Right and End It Well. It enables teachers to connect with their pupils through a variety of meaningful activities.
